src.utils module¶

See all the bounding boxes (NOTE COMMENTS OF ERRORS) in this gist

https://gist.github.com/graydon/11198540

class src.utils.Region(name, lonmin, lonmax, latmin, latmax)¶

Bases: tuple

property latmax¶

Alias for field number 4

property latmin¶

Alias for field number 3

property lonmax¶

Alias for field number 2

property lonmin¶

Alias for field number 1

property name¶

Alias for field number 0

src.utils.create_shape_aligned_climatology(ds, clim, variable, time_period)¶

match the time dimension of clim to the shape of ds so that can perform simple calculations / arithmetic on the values of clim

dsxr.Dataset

the dataset with the raw values that you are comparing to climatology

clim: xr.Dataset

the climatology values for a given time_period

variable: str

name of the variable that you are comparing to the climatology

time_period: str
the period string used to calculate the climatology

time_period = {‘dayofyear’, ‘season’, ‘month’}

Notes:

1. assumes that lat and lon are the coord names in ds

src.utils.drop_nans_and_flatten(dataArray: xarray.core.dataarray.DataArray) → numpy.ndarray¶

flatten the array and drop nans from that array. Useful for plotting histograms.

: dataArray (xr.DataArray)

the DataArray of your value you want to flatten

src.utils.get_ds_mask(ds: xarray.core.dataset.Dataset) → xarray.core.dataset.Dataset¶

Return a boolean Dataset which is a mask of the first timestep in ds NOTE:

assumes that all of the null values from ds are valid null values (e.g. water bodies). Could also be invalid nulls due to poor data processing / lack of satellite input data for a pixel!

src.utils.get_east_africa() → src.utils.Region¶
src.utils.get_ethiopia() → src.utils.Region¶
src.utils.get_kenya() → src.utils.Region¶

This pipeline is focused on drought prediction in Kenya. This function allows Kenya’s bounding box to be easily accessed by all exporters.

src.utils.minus_months(cur_year: int, cur_month: int, diff_months: int, to_endmonth_datetime: bool = True) → Tuple[int, int, Optional[datetime.date]]¶

Given a year-month pair (e.g. 2018, 1), and a number of months subtracted from that diff_months (e.g. 2), return the new year-month pair (e.g. 2017, 11).

Optionally, a date object representing the end of that month can be returned too
